message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.NE 

This paper deals with action recognition in videos using a novel representation called Action Genome, which decomposes actions into spatio-temporal scene graphs. This involves computer vision (cs.CV) techniques for analyzing videos, as well as machine learning (cs.AI, cs.LG) for incorporating scene graphs into an existing action recognition model. The paper also discusses the use of natural language processing (cs.CL) for annotating the dataset, and the application of few-shot learning (cs.NE) for recognizing actions with limited examples.
